007package renderer.scene.util;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.Primitive;
011
012import java.io.File;
013import java.io.PrintWriter;
014import java.lang.Runtime;
015import java.util.List;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.awt.Color;
018
019/**
020   This program converts a {@link Scene} data structure into
021   a DOT description of the scene. The DOT description is
022   written to a file and that file is processed by the
023   dot.exe program to produce a png file graphical image
024   of the scene data structure.
025<p>
026   A <code>scene.png</code> image file is created from
027   a <code>scene.dot</code> file with the following
028   command-line.
029   <pre>{@code
030   > dot.exe -Tpng -O scene.dot
031   }</pre>
032<p>
033   See
034<br><a href="https://www.graphviz.org/Documentation.php" target="_top">
035             https://www.graphviz.org/Documentation.php</a>
036<p>
037   This class has four static boolean variables that can be used
038   to control the complexity of the scene graph drawing.
039*/
040public class DrawSceneGraph
041{
042   // These four variables allow us to turn on and off the
043   // the drawing of many details in the scene graph.
044   // This helps control the complexity of the scene graph.
045   /**
046      Control the details shown in a {@link Camera} node.
047   */
048   public static boolean drawCameraDetails = true;
049   /**
050      Control the display of {@link Matrix} nodes.
051   */
052   public static boolean drawMatrix = true;
053   /**
054      Control the details shown in a {@link Matrix} node.
055   */
056   public static boolean drawMatrixDetails = true;
057   /**
058      Control the details shown below a {@link Model} node.
059   */
060   public static boolean drawVertexList = false;
061
062   // These three variables are used to detect those
063   // nodes in the DAG that have multiple parents.
064   private static List<Object> visitedNodes = null;
065   private static List<String> visitedNodeNames = null;
066   private static int nodeNumber;
067
068   /**
069      This method converts a {@link Scene} data structure into a dot
070      language description. The dot code for the scene is written into
071      a dot file. Then the dot.exe program is called to convert the dot
072      file into a png image of the scene data structure.
073
074      @param scene     {@link Scene} that needs to be converted to a dot description
075      @param fileName  base name for the dot and png files
076   */
077   public static void draw(final Scene scene, final String fileName)
078   {
079      // Convert the scene data structure into a dot language description.
080      final String dotDescription = scene2dot(scene);
081
082      // Write the dot language description stored in dotDescription
083      // into a dot file. Then use the dot.exe program to convert the
084      // dot file into a png file.
085      try
086      {
087         // Create the (empty) dot file.
088         final String baseName = fileName;
089         java.io.PrintWriter out = new PrintWriter(
090                                      new File(baseName + ".dot"));
091
092         // Write the dot commands into the dot file.
093         out.print( dotDescription );
094         out.close();
095
096         // Create a command-line for running the dot.exe program.
097         final String dotExecutable = "C:\\Graphviz\\bin\\dot.exe";
098         final String[] cmd = {dotExecutable,
099                               "-Tpng",
100                               baseName + ".dot",
101                               "-o",
102                               baseName + ".png"};
103         // C:\Graphviz\bin\dot.exe -Tpng  baseName.dot -o baseName.png
104
105         final File dot = new File(dotExecutable);
106         if(dot.exists() && !dot.isDirectory())
107         {
108            // Execute the command-line to create the png file.
109            Runtime.getRuntime().exec(cmd);
110         }
111         else
112         {
113            System.out.println("\nPlease consider installing GraphViz:");
114            System.out.println("  https://graphviz.org/download/");
115            System.out.println("or upload the contents of " + baseName + ".dot to Graphviz Visual Editor:");
116            System.out.println("  http://magjac.com/graphviz-visual-editor/");
117         }
118      }
119      catch (Exception e)
120      {
121         System.out.println( e );
122      }
123   }
124
125
126   /**
127      This method generates a dot language description of the
128      DAG rooted at a {@link Scene} node.
129      <p>
130      This method generates the dot code for the forest of top-level
131      positions just below the scene node. Each position node just
132      below the scene node is the root of a DAG. This method calls
133      the <code>position2dot()</code> method to recursively traverse
134      the DAG of each top-level position.
135
136      @param  scene  {@link Scene} that needs to be converted to a dot description
137      @return a {@link String} containing the dot language description of the scene
138   */
139   public static String scene2dot(final Scene scene)
140   {
141      // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48266439/getting-graphviz-to-eliminate-identical-duplicate-edges
142      String result = "strict digraph {\n";
143
144      // https://graphviz.org/docs/attrs/ordering/
145      result += "graph [ordering=\"out\"];\n";
146
147      // https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10879115/graphviz-change-font-for-the-whole-graph
148      // https://graphviz.org/docs/attrs/fontname/
149      result += "graph [fontname=\"helvetica\"];\n";
150      result += "node  [fontname=\"helvetica\"];\n";
151      result += "edge  [fontname=\"helvetica\"];\n";
152
153      // Scene node.
154      result += "scene [label=\"Scene: " + scene.name + "\"];\n";
155
156      // Camera and List<Position> nodes under the Scene node.
157
158      // Camera node and label.
159      final String cameraNodeName = "Camera";
160      result += cameraNodeName + " ";
161      if (drawCameraDetails)
162      {
163         result += "[label=\"" + scene.camera + "\"];\n";
164      }
165      else
166      {
167         result += "[label=\"Camera\"];\n";
168      }
169      // Camera edge.
170      result += "scene -> " + cameraNodeName + ";\n";
171
172      // List<Position> node and label.
173      final String pListNodeName = "positionList";
174      result += pListNodeName + " ";
175      result += "[label=\"List<Position>\"];\n";
176      // List<Position> edge.
177      result += "scene -> " + pListNodeName + ";\n";
178
179      visitedNodes = new ArrayList<>();
180      visitedNodeNames = new ArrayList<>();
181      nodeNumber = -1;
182
183      // For each top-level Position, create a node with three edges,
184      // its model, its matrix, and its list of nested positions.
185      for (int i = 0; i < scene.positionList.size(); ++i)
186      {
187         // Position node name.
188         ++nodeNumber;
189         final String pNodeName = "_p" + nodeNumber;
190
191         // Mark this position as visited.
192         final Position positionReference = scene.getPosition(i);
193         visitedNodes.add(positionReference);
194         visitedNodeNames.add(pNodeName);
195
196         // Position node and label.
197         result += pNodeName + " ";
198         result += "[label=\"Position: " + positionReference.name + "\"];\n";
199
200         // Position edge.
201         result += pListNodeName + " -> " + pNodeName + ";\n";
202
203         // This Position's matrix, model, and nested positions.
204         result += position2dot(positionReference, pNodeName);
205      }
206
207      result += "}\n";
208
209      return result;
210   }
211
212
213   /**
214      This method generates a dot language description of the
215      DAG rooted at a {@link Position} node.
216      <p>
217      This method is essentially a preorder traversal of the
218      DAG rooted at the {@link Position} node.
219      <p>
220      {@code positionName} is the id that has been assigned to
221      the dot node representing the given {@link Position} node.
222      <p>
223      Every {@link Position} node has attached to it a {@link Matrix},
224      a {@link Model}, and a {@link List} of nested positions.
225
226      @param position      {@link Position} that needs to be converted to a dot description
227      @param positionName  the {@link String} name that has been assigned to {@code position}
228      @return a {@link String} containing the dot language description of {@code position}
229   */
230   public static String position2dot(final Position position,
231                                     final String positionName)
232   {
233      String result = "";
234
235      if (drawMatrix || drawMatrixDetails)
236      {
237         // Matrix node name.
238         final String tNodeName = positionName + "_Matrix";
239
240         // Matrix node and label.
241         result += tNodeName + " ";
242
243         if (drawMatrixDetails)
244         {
245            result += "[label=\"Matrix:\n" + position.getMatrix() + "\"];\n";
246         }
247         else
248         {
249            result += "[label=\"Matrix\"];\n";
250         }
251
252         // Matrix edge.
253         result += positionName + " -> " + tNodeName + ";\n";
254       //result += positionName + " -> " + tNodeName + " [constraint=false];\n";
255      }
256
257      // The position's model.
258      final Model modelReference = position.getModel();
259
260      // Check if the Model is being reused.
261      final boolean modelVisited = visitedNodes.contains(modelReference);
262
263      if ( ! modelVisited )
264      {
265         // Model node name.
266         ++nodeNumber;
267         final String mNodeName = "_m" + nodeNumber;
268         // Mark this model as visited.
269         visitedNodes.add(modelReference);
270         visitedNodeNames.add(mNodeName);
271
272         // Model node and label.
273         result += mNodeName + " ";
274         result += "[label=\"Model: " + modelReference.name + "\"];\n";
275
276         // Model edge.
277         result += positionName + " -> " + mNodeName + ";\n";
278
279         // The model's vertex, color, and primitive lists.
280         result += model2dot(modelReference, mNodeName);
281      }
282      else // this Model has already been visited
283      {
284         final int index = visitedNodes.indexOf(modelReference);
285         // Model node name.
286         final String mNodeName = visitedNodeNames.get(index);
287         // Model edge (to a previously visited Model node).
288         result += positionName + " -> " + mNodeName + ";\n";
289      }
290
291      // Recursively convert this position's nested positions
292      // into a dot description.
293      if ( ! position.nestedPositions.isEmpty() )
294      {
295         // Nested position list node and label.
296         final String nestedPositionListNodeName = positionName + "_List ";
297         result += nestedPositionListNodeName + " ";
298         result += "[label=\"List<Position>\"];\n";
299         // Nested position list edge.
300         result += positionName + " -> " + nestedPositionListNodeName + ";\n";
301
302         for (int i = 0; i < position.nestedPositions.size(); ++i)
303         {
304            // Nested position.
305            final Position positionReference = position.getNestedPosition(i);
306
307            // Check if the Position is being reused.
308            final boolean positionVisited = visitedNodes.contains(positionReference);
309
310            if ( ! positionVisited )
311            {
312               // Nested position node name.
313               ++nodeNumber;
314               final String pNodeName = "_p" + nodeNumber;
315               // Mark this position as visited.
316               visitedNodes.add(positionReference);
317               visitedNodeNames.add(pNodeName);
318
319               // Nested position node and label.
320               result += pNodeName + " ";
321               result += "[label=\"Position: " + positionReference.name + "\"];\n";
322
323               // Nested position edge.
324               result += nestedPositionListNodeName + " -> " + pNodeName + ";\n";
325
326               // The nested position's matrix, model, and nested positions.
327               result += position2dot(positionReference, pNodeName);
328            }
329            else // this Position has already been visited
330            {
331               final int index = visitedNodes.indexOf(positionReference);
332               // Nested position node name.
333               final String pNodeName = visitedNodeNames.get(index);
334               // Nested position edge (to a previously visited Position node).
335               result += nestedPositionListNodeName + " -> " + pNodeName + ";\n";
336            }
337         }
338      }
339
340      return result;
341   }
342
343
344   /**
345      This method generates a dot language description of the
346      DAG rooted at a {@link Model} node.
347      <p>
348      This method is essentially a preorder traversal of the
349      DAG rooted at the {@link Model} node.
350      <p>
351      {@code nodeName} is the id that has been assigned to the
352      dot node representing the given {@link Model} node.
353      <p>
354      Every {@link Model} node has attached to it a {@link List}
355      of vertices, a {@link List} of colors, a {@link List}
356      of primitives, a {@link Matrix}, a {@link List} of
357      nested models, {@link List} of textures, and a
358      {@link List} of texture coordinates.
359
360      @param model  {@link Model} that needs to be converted to a dot description
361      @param nodeName  the {@link String} name that has been assigned to {@code model}
362      @return a {@link String} containing the dot language description of the model
363   */
364   public static String model2dot(final Model model,
365                                  final String nodeName)
366   {
367      String result = "";
368
369      if (drawMatrix || drawMatrixDetails)
370      {
371         // Matrix node name.
372         final String tNodeName = nodeName + "_Matrix";
373
374         // Matrix node and label.
375         result += tNodeName + " ";
376
377         if (drawMatrixDetails)
378         {
379            result += "[label=\"Matrix:\n" + model.getMatrix() + "\"];\n";
380         }
381         else
382         {
383            result += "[label=\"Matrix\"];\n";
384         }
385
386         // Matrix edge.
387         result += nodeName + " -> " + tNodeName + ";\n";
388       //result += nodeName + " -> " + tNodeName + " [constraint=false];\n";
389      }
390
391      if (drawVertexList)
392      {
393         // List<Vertex> node and label.
394         final String vertexListNodeName = nodeName + "_vertexList";
395         result += vertexListNodeName + " ";
396         result += "[label=\"List<Vertex>\"];\n";
397         // List<Vertex> edge.
398         result += nodeName + " -> " + vertexListNodeName + ";\n";
399         // List<Vertex> children.
400         int vertexCounter = 0;
401         String lastVertexNodeName = vertexListNodeName;
402         for (Vertex v : model.vertexList)
403         {
404            // Vertex node name.
405            final String vertexNodeName = nodeName + "_v" + vertexCounter;
406
407            // Vertex node and label.
408            result += vertexNodeName + " ";
409            result += "[label=\"Vertex: " + v + "\"];\n";
410
411            // Vertex edge.
412            result += lastVertexNodeName + " -> " + vertexNodeName + ";\n";
413
414            lastVertexNodeName = vertexNodeName;
415            ++vertexCounter;
416         }
417
418
419         // List<Color> node and label.
420         final String colorListNodeName = nodeName + "_colorList";
421         result += colorListNodeName + " ";
422         result += "[label=\"List<Color>\"];\n";
423         // List<Color> edge.
424         result += nodeName + " -> " + colorListNodeName + ";\n";
425         // List<Color> children.
426         int colorCounter = 0;
427         String lastColorNodeName = colorListNodeName;
428         for (Color c : model.colorList)
429         {
430            // Color node name.
431            final String colorNodeName = nodeName + "_c" + colorCounter;
432
433            // Color node and label.
434            result += colorNodeName + " ";
435            result += "[label=\"" + c + "\"];\n";
436
437            // Color edge.
438            result += lastColorNodeName + " -> " + colorNodeName + ";\n";
439
440            lastColorNodeName = colorNodeName;
441            ++colorCounter;
442         }
443
444
445         // List<Texture> node and label.
446         final String textureListNodeName = nodeName + "_textureList";
447         result += textureListNodeName + " ";
448         result += "[label=\"List<Texture>\"];\n";
449         // List<Texture> edge.
450         result += nodeName + " -> " + textureListNodeName + ";\n";
451         // List<Texture> children.
452         int textureCounter = 0;
453         String lastTextureNodeName = textureListNodeName;
454         for (Texture tex : model.textureList)
455         {
456            // Texture node name.
457            final String textureNodeName = nodeName + "_tex" + textureCounter;
458
459            // Texture node and label.
460            result += textureNodeName + " ";
461            result += "[label=\"Texture: " + tex.name + "\"];\n";
462
463            // Texture edge.
464            result += lastTextureNodeName + " -> " + textureNodeName + ";\n";
465
466            lastTextureNodeName = textureNodeName;
467            ++textureCounter;
468         }
469
470
471         // List<TexCoord> node and label.
472         final String texCoordListNodeName = nodeName + "_texCoordList";
473         result += texCoordListNodeName + " ";
474         result += "[label=\"List<TexCoord>\"];\n";
475         // List<TexCoord> edge.
476         result += nodeName + " -> " + texCoordListNodeName + ";\n";
477         // List<TexCoord> children.
478         int texCoordCounter = 0;
479         String lastTexCoordNodeName = texCoordListNodeName;
480         for (TexCoord texCoord : model.texCoordList)
481         {
482            // TexCoord node name.
483            final String texCoordNodeName = nodeName + "_texCoord" + texCoordCounter;
484
485            // TexCoord node and label.
486            result += texCoordNodeName + " ";
487            result += "[label=\"TexCoord: " + texCoord + "\"];\n";
488
489            // TexCoord edge.
490            result += lastTexCoordNodeName + " -> " + texCoordNodeName + ";\n";
491
492            lastTexCoordNodeName = texCoordNodeName;
493            ++texCoordCounter;
494         }
495
496
497         // List<Primitive> node and label.
498         final String primitiveListNodeName = nodeName + "_primitiveList";
499         result += primitiveListNodeName + " ";
500         result += "[label=\"List<Primitive>\"];\n";
501         // List<Primitive> edge.
502         result += nodeName + " -> " + primitiveListNodeName + ";\n";
503         // List<Primitive> children.
504         int primitiveCounter = 0;
505         String lastPrimitiveNodeName = primitiveListNodeName;
506         for (Primitive p : model.primitiveList)
507         {
508            // Primitive node name.
509            final String primitiveNodeName = nodeName + "_p" + primitiveCounter;
510
511            // Primitive node and label.
512            result += primitiveNodeName + " ";
513            result += "[label=\"" + p + "\"];\n";
514
515            // Primitive edge.
516            result += lastPrimitiveNodeName + " -> " + primitiveNodeName + ";\n";
517
518            lastPrimitiveNodeName = primitiveNodeName;
519            ++primitiveCounter;
520         }
521      }
522
523      // Recursively convert this model's nested models
524      // into a dot description.
525      if ( ! model.nestedModels.isEmpty() )
526      {
527         // Nested model list node and label.
528         final String nestedModelListNodeName = nodeName + "_List ";
529         result += nestedModelListNodeName + " ";
530         result += "[label=\"List<Model>\"];\n";
531         // Nested model list edge.
532         result += nodeName + " -> " + nestedModelListNodeName + ";\n";
533
534         for (int i = 0; i < model.nestedModels.size(); ++i)
535         {
536            // Nested model.
537            final Model modelReference = model.getNestedModel(i);
538
539            // Check if the Model is being reused.
540            final boolean modelVisited = visitedNodes.contains(modelReference);
541
542            if ( ! modelVisited )
543            {
544               // Nested model node name.
545               ++nodeNumber;
546               final String mNodeName = "_m" + nodeNumber;
547               // Mark this model as visited.
548               visitedNodes.add(modelReference);
549               visitedNodeNames.add(mNodeName);
550
551               // Nested model node and label.
552               result += mNodeName + " ";
553               result += "[label=\"Model: " + modelReference.name + "\"];\n";
554
555               // Nested model edge.
556               result += nestedModelListNodeName + " -> " + mNodeName + ";\n";
557
558               // The nested model's matrix and nested models.
559               result += model2dot(modelReference, mNodeName);
560            }
561            else // this nested Model has already been visited
562            {
563               final int index = visitedNodes.indexOf(modelReference);
564               // Nested model node name.
565               final String mNodeName = visitedNodeNames.get(index);
566               // Nested model edge.
567               result += nestedModelListNodeName + " -> " + mNodeName + ";\n";
568            }
569         }
570      }
571
572      return result;
573   }
574
575
576   // Private default constructor to enforce noninstantiable class.
577   // See Item 4 in "Effective Java", 3rd Ed, Joshua Bloch.
578   private DrawSceneGraph() {
579      throw new AssertionError();
580   }
581}
